question: Ingestion of which of the following cause(s) human cysticercosis?

question: Which of the following is the definitive host of the tiny tapeworm, Echinococcus granulosus?

A 20-year-old male presents to the emergency department with complaints of fever, fatigue, and headache for the past 10 days. He is now experiencing agitation and hallucination, with aggressive behavior. History suggests that he suffered a dog bite 4 weeks ago. On examination, he is found to have excessive salivation, hyperreflexia, and spasticity. What is the most probable diagnosis?

Her urine turns black on exposure to air. Which of the following organisms is the cause of the patient's symptoms?

Non bloody diarrhea in immunocompetent patients for long duration
Self limiting diarrhea in immunocompromised patients
Watery diarrhea in immunocompetent patients for long duration
Bloody diarrhea in immunocompetent patients for short duration

HPV-16 and HPV-18 cause genital warts

question: In a nearby daycare center, a group of children develops severe perianal itching and pruritis. Their mothers also identify pumpkin seed-like structures in children's stools. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of these symptoms?

History suggests that he is working at a tandoor (roti) shop for the last 3 months and lives in an unhygienic environment. He drinks tap water. A 68-year-old male presents to the emergency room with complaints of diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. History suggests that he is immunocompromised and suffering from prostate carcinoma for the past 6 years. His laboratory investigations reveal low hemoglobin, raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), and decreased total leukocyte count (TLC). His diagnosis is made by detecting oocysts in fecal smear with the help of a modified Kinyoun acid-fast stain. Which of the following organisms is responsible for his symptoms?

answers.option: It is common in developed countries

question: A person was bitten by a mosquito and later developed malaria. Which of the following does the mosquito inject when it takes a blood meal?

A 41-year-old man, with a history of HIV/AIDS, presents to the outpatient clinic with worsening dyspnea and cough for the last 5 days. answers.option: Immediate debridement and cleaning of the wound

question: A 46-year-old female suffers an injury on her foot with a rusty nail while walking barefoot on her lawn. She rushes to the emergency department and seeks medical help. The doctor cleans her wound with normal saline and dresses her wound. Which of the following is most likely to cause an infection in her case?

A 45-year-old male comes to his doctor with the chief complaints of fever, night sweats, and increased episodes of diarrhea during the past month. He has lost 30 pounds over the past 4 months. question: A 27-year-old pregnant lady arrives at the emergency with extreme labor pain and is rushed to the labor room for the delivery. Her history suggests that she previously had a herpes simplex virus 2 infection. Which of the following is correct for neonatal herpes?

answers.option: Neonatal infection is more likely to occur when mother is suffering from recurrent infection
Mother would pass IgM antibodies which can protect neonate from disseminated infection
Vaginal delivery has lesser chances of delivering infection to neonate as compared with caesarean section
Amount of virus produced during primary infection is less than produced in a secondary infection
Neonatal herpes chiefly originates from contact with vesicular lesions within the birth canal

question: A 30-year-old man presents to the medical outpatient department with a complaint of pain during urination. He also complains of purulent urethral discharge and gives a history of sexual contact 7 days ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?
